modelIdentification.name: SISO-STD-001.1-2015 - Real-time Platform Reference Base FOM Module
modelIdentification.purpose: The RPR FOM supports interoperability for real-time, platform oriented defense simulation.
modelIdentification.description: This module provides a common base for RPR based FOM Modules. It contains common datatypes and the BaseEntity and EmbeddedSystem object class definitions.

reference.identification: Real-time Platform Reference Enumerations FOM Module
Standard for Guidance, Rationale, and Interoperability Modalities for the Real-time Platform Reference Federation Object Model (RPR FOM) SISO-STD-001-2015 10 August 2015
IEEE Standard for Distributed Interactive Simulation - Application Protocols IEEE Std 1278.1-1995 September 21, 1995
IEEE Standard for Distributed Interactive Simulation - Application Protocols IEEE Std 1278.1a-1998 19 March 1998

objectClass.name: BaseEntity
objectClass.semantics: A base class of aggregate and discrete scenario domain participants. The BaseEntity class is characterized by being located at a particular location in space and independently movable, if capable of movement at all. It specifically excludes elements normally considered to be a component of another element. The BaseEntity class is intended to be a container for common attributes for entities of this type. Since it lacks sufficient class specific attributes that are required for simulation purposes, federates cannot publish objects of this class. Certain simulation management federates, e.g. viewers, may subscribe to this class. Simulation federates will normally subscribe to one of the subclasses, to gain the extra information required to properly simulate the entity.

attribute.name: EntityIdentifier
attribute.semantics: The unique identifier for the entity instance.

attribute.name: IsPartOf
attribute.semantics: Defines if the entity if a constituent part of another entity (denoted the host entity). If the entity is a constituent part of another entity then the HostEntityIdentifier shall be set to the EntityIdentifier of the host entity and the HostRTIObjectIdentifier shall be set to the RTI object instance ID of the host entity. If the entity is not a constituent part of another entity then the HostEntityIdentifier shall be set to 0.0.0 and the HostRTIObjectIdentifier shall be set to the empty string.

attribute.name: Spatial
attribute.semantics: Spatial state stored in one variant record attribute.

attribute.name: RelativeSpatial
attribute.semantics: Relative spatial state stored in one variant record attribute.

objectClass.name: EmbeddedSystem
objectClass.semantics: A base class used to associate components such as sensor and emitting systems with their parent entity object.

attribute.name: EntityIdentifier
attribute.semantics: The EntityIdentifier of the object which this embedded system is a part of.

attribute.name: HostObjectIdentifier
attribute.semantics: The RTI object instance ID of the object of which this embedded system is part of.

attribute.name: RelativePosition
attribute.semantics: The position of the embedded system, relative to the host object's position.

updateReflectTag.semantics: User-supplied tag provided with each update/reflect of object instance attribute values. Contains at least the DIS timestamp in the first 8 characters.

sendReceiveTag.semantics: User-supplied tag provided with each send/receive of an interaction. Contains at least the DIS timestamp in the first 8 characters.

simpleData.name: AccelerationMeterPerSecondSquaredFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Linear acceleration vector composed of SI base units. Based on the Linear Acceleration Vector record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.33b.

simpleData.name: AngleDegreeFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Angle, based on unit degree (of arc), unit symbol °.

simpleData.name: AngleRadianFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Angle, based on SI derived unit radian, unit symbol rad.

simpleData.name: AngularVelocityRadianPerSecondFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Angular velocity vector composed of SI base units. Based on the Angular Velocity Vector record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.2.

simpleData.name: ClockTimeHourInteger32
simpleData.semantics: Time past on the clock in full hours since a specified point in time.

simpleData.name: DepthMeterFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Depth, based on SI base unit meter, unit symbol m.

simpleData.name: Float32
simpleData.semantics: Single-precision floating point number.

simpleData.name: Float64
simpleData.semantics: Double-precision floating point number.

simpleData.name: FrequencyHertzFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Frequency, based on SI derived unit hertz, unit symbol Hz.

simpleData.name: Integer16
simpleData.semantics: Integer in the range [-2^15, 2^15-1].

simpleData.name: Integer32
simpleData.semantics: Integer in the range [-2^31, 2^31-1].

simpleData.name: InterrogationsPerSecondFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Number of interrogations per second.

simpleData.name: LengthMeterFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Length, based on SI base unit meter, unit symbol m.

simpleData.name: MassKilogramFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Mass, based on SI base unit kilogram, unit symbol kg.

simpleData.name: MeterFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Datatype based on SI base unit meter, unit symbol m.

simpleData.name: MeterFloat64
simpleData.semantics: Datatype based on SI base unit meter, unit symbol m.

simpleData.name: Octet
simpleData.semantics: Uninterpreted 8-bit value.

simpleData.name: PercentFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Percentage

simpleData.name: PercentUnsignedInteger32
simpleData.semantics: Percentage

simpleData.name: PowerRatioDecibelMilliwattFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Power ratio in decibels (dB) of a measured power referenced to 1 milliwatt (mW).

simpleData.name: RevolutionsPerMinuteInteger16
simpleData.semantics: Frequency of rotation, expressed in revolutions per minute.

simpleData.name: TemperatureDegreeCelsiusFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Temperature, based on SI derived unit degree Celsius, unit symbol °C.

simpleData.name: TimeMicrosecondFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Time, based on SI base unit second, expressed in microsecond, unit symbol μs.

simpleData.name: TimeMillisecondUnsignedInteger32
simpleData.semantics: Time, based on SI base unit second, expressed in millisecond, unit symbol ms.

simpleData.name: TimeSecondInteger32
simpleData.semantics: Time, based on SI base unit second, unit symbol s.

simpleData.name: TimestampUnsignedInteger32
simpleData.semantics: The time past the hour, scaled so that value 0 represents the start of the hour and value 2^31 - 1 represents one time unit before the start of the next hour, thereby resulting in each time unit representing exactly 3600/(2^31) s, which is approximately 1.67638063 microsecond.

simpleData.name: UnsignedInteger16
simpleData.semantics: Integer in the range [0, 2^16-1].

simpleData.name: UnsignedInteger32
simpleData.semantics: Integer in the range [0, 2^32-1].

simpleData.name: UnsignedInteger64
simpleData.semantics: Integer in the range [0, 2^64-1].

simpleData.name: UnsignedInteger8
simpleData.semantics: Integer in the range [0, 2^8-1].

simpleData.name: VelocityMeterPerSecondFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Speed/Velocity in meter per second.

simpleData.name: WavelengthMicronFloat32
simpleData.semantics: Wavelength expressed in micrometer.

arrayData.name: RPRUserDefinedTag
arrayData.semantics:
The array shall be at least 8 bytes (octets) in size, which shall contain the time according to the DIS time stamp field format (IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.31) converted into hexadecimal American Standard Code for Information Interchange (ASCII) character representation (0-9 and A-F), with leading zeros included. The ordering of the characters shall be in accordance with section 5.1.1 of IEEE 1278.1-1995, that is most significant octet first, with the most significant bits first (i.e. the character for bits 4-7 precedes the character for bits 0-3). This encoding is equivalent to the result of the 'C'-statement "sprintf(UserTag, "%08X", DIStimestamp)," where 'DIStimestamp' is represented in native format.
More user-supplied information may be included, starting from the 9th character, as specified in the federation agreements.

arrayData.name: ArticulatedParameterStructLengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Dynamic array of ArticulatedParameterStruct elements, may also contain no elements. The array is encoded without array length, containing only the elements.

arrayData.name: ClockTimeStructLengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Dynamic array of ClockTimeStruct elements, may also contain no elements. The array is encoded without array length, containing only the elements.

arrayData.name: EntityTypeStructLengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Dynamic array of EntityTypeStruct elements, may also contain no elements. The array is encoded without array length, containing only the elements.

arrayData.name: Float32Array1Plus
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of Float32 elements, containing at least one element.

arrayData.name: Integer16Array1Plus
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of Integer16 elements, containing at least one element.

arrayData.name: OctetArray
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of Octet elements, may also contain no elements.

arrayData.name: OctetArray1Plus
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of Octet elements, containing at least one element.

arrayData.name: OctetArray2
arrayData.semantics: Generic array of two Octet elements.

arrayData.name: OctetArray3
arrayData.semantics: Generic array of three Octet elements.

arrayData.name: OctetArray4
arrayData.semantics: Generic array of four Octet elements.

arrayData.name: OctetArray7
arrayData.semantics: Generic array of seven Octet elements.

arrayData.name: OctetArray8
arrayData.semantics: Generic array of eight Octet elements.

arrayData.name: OctetPadding32Array
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of meaningless Octet elements, to align the subsequent data structure to the next 32 bit octet boundary value (OBV). The array is encoded without array length, containing zero to three elements.

arrayData.name: OctetPadding64Array
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of meaningless Octet elements, to align the subsequent data structure to the next 64 bit octet boundary value (OBV). The array is encoded without array length, containing zero to seven elements.

arrayData.name: OrientationStructLengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Dynamic array of OrientationStruct elements, may also contain no elements. The array is encoded without array length, containing only the elements.

arrayData.name: UnsignedInteger16Array1Plus
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of UnsignedInteger16 elements, containing at least one element.

arrayData.name: UnsignedInteger32LengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of UnsignedInteger32 elements, may also contain no elements. The array is encoded without array length, containing only the elements.

arrayData.name: UnsignedInteger64Array1Plus
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of UnsignedInteger64 elements, containing at least one element.

arrayData.name: UnsignedInteger8LengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Generic dynamic array of UnsignedInteger8 elements, may also contain no elements. The array is encoded without array length, containing only the elements.

arrayData.name: WorldLocationStructLengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Dynamic array of WorldLocationStruct elements, may also contain no elements. The array is encoded without array length, containing only the elements.

fixedRecordData.name: AccelerationVectorStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The magnitude of the change in linear velocity over time.

field.name: XAcceleration
field.semantics: Acceleration component along the X axis.

field.name: YAcceleration
field.semantics: Acceleration component along the Y axis.

field.name: ZAcceleration
field.semantics: Acceleration component along the Z axis.

fixedRecordData.name: AngularVelocityVectorStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The rate at which the orientation is changing over time, in body coordinates.

field.name: XAngularVelocity
field.semantics: Acceleration component about the X axis.

field.name: YAngularVelocity
field.semantics: Acceleration component about the Y axis.

field.name: ZAngularVelocity
field.semantics: Acceleration component about the Z axis.

fixedRecordData.name: ArticulatedParameterStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics:
Structure to specify a movable or attached part of an entity. Based on the Articulation Parameter record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.5.
Note that usage of this datatype for the PhyscialEntity object class attribute ArticulatedParametersArray and MunitionDetonation interaction class parameter ArticulatedPartData shall be in accordance with IEEE 1278.1-1995 Annex A.

field.name: ArticulatedParameterChange
field.semantics: Indicator of a change to the part. This field shall be set to zero for each exercise and sequentially incremented by one for each change in articulation parameters. In the case where all possible values are exhausted, the numbers shall be reused beginning at zero.

field.name: PartAttachedTo
field.semantics: Identification of the articulated part to which this articulation parameter is attached. This field shall contain the value zero if the articulated part is attached directly to the entity.

field.name: ParameterValue
field.semantics: Details of the parameter: whether it is an articulated or an attached part, and its type and value.

fixedRecordData.name: ArticulatedPartsStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Structure to represent the state of a movable part of an entity.

field.name: Class
field.semantics: The type class uniquely identifies a particular articulated part on a given entity type. Guidance for uniquely assigning type classes to an entity's articulated parts is given in section 4.8 of the enumeration document (SISO-REF-010).

field.name: TypeMetric
field.semantics: The type metric uniquely identifies the transformation to be applied to the articulated part.

field.name: Value
field.semantics: Value of the transformation to be applied to the articulated part.

fixedRecordData.name: AttachedPartsStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Structure to represent removable parts that may be attached to an entity.

field.name: Station
field.semantics: Identification of the location (or station) to which the part is attached.

field.name: StoreType
field.semantics: The entity type of the attached part.

fixedRecordData.name: ClockTimeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specification of the point in time of an occurrence. Based on the Clock Time record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.8.

field.name: Hours
field.semantics: The number of hours since 0000 hours, January 1, 1970 UTC.

field.name: TimePastTheHour
field.semantics: The time past the hour indicated in the Hours field.

fixedRecordData.name: ConstituentPartRelationshipStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The relationship of the constituent part object to its host object. Based on the Relationship record as specified in IEEE 1278.1a-1998 section 5.2.56.

field.name: Nature
field.semantics: The nature or purpose for the joining of the constituent part object to the host object.

field.name: Position
field.semantics: The position of the constituent part object with respect to the host object.

fixedRecordData.name: DimensionStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Bounding box in X,Y,Z axis.

field.name: XAxisLength
field.semantics: Length in meters along X axis.

field.name: YAxisLength
field.semantics: Length in meters along Y axis.

field.name: ZAxisLength
field.semantics: Length in meters along Z axis.

fixedRecordData.name: EntityIdentifierStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Unique, exercise-wide identification of the entity, or a symbolic group address referencing multiple entities or a simulation application. Based on the Entity Identifier record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.14.

field.name: FederateIdentifier
field.semantics: Simulation application (federate) identifier.

field.name: EntityNumber
field.semantics: Each entity in a given simulation application shall be given an entity identifier number unique to all other entities in that application. This identifier number is valid for the duration of the exercise; however, entity identifier numbers may be reused when all possible numbers have been exhausted. No entity shall have an entity identifier number of NO_ENTITY (0), ALL_ENTITIES (0xFFFF), or RQST_ASSIGN_ID (0xFFFE). The entity identifier number need not be registered or retained for future exercises. An entity identifier number equal to zero with valid site and application identification shall address a simulation application. An entity identifier number equal to ALL_ENTITIES shall mean all entities within the specified site and application. An entity identifier number equal to RQST_ASSIGN_ID allows the receiver of the CreateEntity interaction to define the entity identifier number of the new entity. The new entity will specify its entity identifier number in the Acknowledge interaction.

fixedRecordData.name: EntityTypeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Type of entity. Based on the Entity Type record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.16.

field.name: EntityKind
field.semantics: Kind of entity.

field.name: Domain
field.semantics: Domain in which the entity operates.

field.name: CountryCode
field.semantics: Country to which the design of the entity is attributed.

field.name: Category
field.semantics: Main category that describes the entity.

field.name: Subcategory
field.semantics: Subcategory to which an entity belongs based on the Category field.

field.name: Specific
field.semantics: Specific information about an entity based on the Subcategory field.

field.name: Extra
field.semantics: Extra information required to describe a particular entity.

fixedRecordData.name: EventIdentifierStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Identification of an event. Based on the Event Identifier record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.18.

field.name: EventCount
field.semantics: The event number. Uniquely assigned by the simulation application (federate) that initiates the sequence of events. It shall be set to one for each exercise and incremented by one for each event. In the case where all possible values are exhausted, the numbers may be reused beginning again at one.

field.name: IssuingObjectIdentifier
field.semantics: Identification of the object issuing the event.

fixedRecordData.name: FederateIdentifierStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Unique identification of the simulation application (federate) in an exercise, or a symbolic group address referencing multiple simulation applications. Based on the Simulation Address record as specified in IEEE 1278.1-1995 section 5.2.14.1.

field.name: SiteID
field.semantics: Each site shall be assigned a unique site identification. No individual site shall be assigned an identification number containing NO_SITE (0) or ALL_SITES (0xFFFF). An identification number equal to ALL_SITES (0xFFFF) shall mean all sites; this may be used to initialize or start all sites. The mechanism by which Site Identification numbers are assigned is part of federation agreements.

field.name: ApplicationID
field.semantics: Each simulation application (federate) at a site shall be assigned an identification number unique within that site. No simulation application shall be assigned an identification number containing NO_APPLIC (0) or ALL_APPLIC (0xFFFF). An application identification number equal to ALL_APPLIC (0xFFFF) shall mean all applications; this may be used to start all applications within a site. One or more simulation applications may reside in a single host computer. The mechanism by which application identification numbers are assigned is part of federation agreements.

fixedRecordData.name: IsPartOfStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Defines the spatial relationship between two objects.

field.name: HostEntityIdentifier
field.semantics: The identifier of the entity of which the object is a constituent part.

field.name: HostRTIObjectIdentifier
field.semantics: The RTI instance identifier of the object of which this object is a constituent part.

field.name: Relationship
field.semantics: The relationship of the constituent part object to its host object.

field.name: NamedLocation
field.semantics: The discrete positional relationship of the constituent part object with respect to its host object.

fixedRecordData.name: LinearSegmentStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies linear object segment characteristics.

field.name: SegmentNumber
field.semantics: Identifies the individual segment.

field.name: PercentComplete
field.semantics: Specifies the percent completion of the segment.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Specifies the location of the segment.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: Specifies the orientation of the segment.

field.name: Length
field.semantics: Specifies the length of the segment, in meters, extending in the positive X direction.

field.name: Width
field.semantics: Specifies the total width of the segment, in meters; one-half of the width shall extend in the positive Y direction, and one-half of the width shall extend in the negative Y direction.

field.name: Height
field.semantics: Specifies the height of the segment, in meters, above ground.

field.name: Depth
field.semantics: Specifies the depth of the segment, in meters, below ground level.

field.name: DamagedState
field.semantics: Specifies the damaged appearance of the segment.

field.name: Deactivated
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment has been deactivated (it has ceased to exist in the synthetic environment).

field.name: Flaming
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment is aflame.

field.name: ObjectPreDistributed
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment was created before the start of the exercise.

field.name: Smoking
field.semantics: Specifies whether or not the segment is smoking (creating a smoke plume).

fixedRecordData.name: NamedLocationStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The discrete positional relationship of the constituent part object with respect to its host object. Based on the specifications in IEEE 1278.1a-1998 of the IsPartOf PDU 'Location of Part' (paragraph 5.3.9.4e) and 'Named Location' (paragraph 5.3.9.4f) fields.

field.name: StationNumber
field.semantics: The number of the particular station at which the constituent part is attached.

field.name: StationName
field.semantics: The name of the station where the constituent part is located.

fixedRecordData.name: OrientationStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The orientation of an object in the world coordinate system, as specified in IEEE Std 1278.1-1995 section 1.3.2.

field.name: Psi
field.semantics: Rotation about the Z axis.

field.name: Theta
field.semantics: Rotation about the Y axis.

field.name: Phi
field.semantics: Rotation about the X axis.

fixedRecordData.name: RelativePositionStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Relative position in right-handed Cartesian coordinates.

field.name: BodyXDistance
field.semantics: The distance from the reference location along the X axis.

field.name: BodyYDistance
field.semantics: The distance from the reference location along the Y axis.

field.name: BodyZDistance
field.semantics: The distance from the reference location along the Z axis.

fixedRecordData.name: RelativeRangeBearingStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Relative position in polar coordinates.

field.name: Range
field.semantics: The range from the reference location.

field.name: Bearing
field.semantics: The bearing from the reference location.

fixedRecordData.name: SpatialFPStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Spatial structure for Dead Reckoning Algorithm FPW (2) and FPB (6).

field.name: WorldLocation
field.semantics: Location of the object.

field.name: IsFrozen
field.semantics: Whether the object is frozen or not.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The angles of rotation around the coordinate axes between the object's attitude and the reference coordinate system axes (calculated as the Tait-Bryan Euler angles specifying the successive rotations needed to transform from the world coordinate system to the entity coordinate system).

field.name: VelocityVector
field.semantics: The rate at which an object's position is changing over time.

fixedRecordData.name: SpatialFVStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Spatial structure for Dead Reckoning Algorithm FVW (5) and RVB (9).

field.name: WorldLocation
field.semantics: Location of the object.

field.name: IsFrozen
field.semantics: Whether the object is frozen or not.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The angles of rotation around the coordinate axes between the object's attitude and the reference coordinate system axes (calculated as the Tait-Bryan Euler angles specifying the successive rotations needed to transform from the world coordinate system to the entity coordinate system).

field.name: VelocityVector
field.semantics: The rate at which an object's position is changing over time.

field.name: AccelerationVector
field.semantics: The magnitude of the change in linear velocity of an object over time.

fixedRecordData.name: SpatialRPStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Spatial structure for Dead Reckoning Algorithm RPW (3) and RPB (7).

field.name: WorldLocation
field.semantics: Location of the object.

field.name: IsFrozen
field.semantics: Whether the object is frozen or not.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The angles of rotation around the coordinate axes between the object's attitude and the reference coordinate system axes (calculated as the Tait-Bryan Euler angles specifying the successive rotations needed to transform from the world coordinate system to the entity coordinate system).

field.name: VelocityVector
field.semantics: The rate at which an object's position is changing over time.

field.name: AngularVelocity
field.semantics: The rate at which an object's orientation is changing over time.

fixedRecordData.name: SpatialRVStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Spatial structure for Dead Reckoning Algorithm RVW (4) and RVB (8).

field.name: WorldLocation
field.semantics: Location of the object.

field.name: IsFrozen
field.semantics: Whether the object is frozen or not.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The angles of rotation around the coordinate axes between the object's attitude and the reference coordinate system axes (calculated as the Tait-Bryan Euler angles specifying the successive rotations needed to transform from the world coordinate system to the entity coordinate system).

field.name: VelocityVector
field.semantics: The rate at which an object's position is changing over time.

field.name: AccelerationVector
field.semantics: The magnitude of the change in linear velocity of an object over time.

field.name: AngularVelocity
field.semantics: The rate at which an object's orientation is changing over time.

fixedRecordData.name: SpatialStaticStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Spatial structure for Dead Reckoning Algorithm Static (1).

field.name: WorldLocation
field.semantics: Location of the object.

field.name: IsFrozen
field.semantics: Whether the object is frozen or not.

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The angles of rotation around the coordinate axes between the object's attitude and the reference coordinate system axes (calculated as the Tait-Bryan Euler angles specifying the successive rotations needed to transform from the world coordinate system to the entity coordinate system).

fixedRecordData.name: VariableDatumStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: These fields shall specify the types of variable datum, their length, and their value.

field.name: DatumID
field.semantics: The fixed datum id represented by a 32-bit enumeration

field.name: DatumLength
field.semantics: This field shall specify the length of the variable datum in bits.

field.name: DatumValue
field.semantics: Value of the variable datum defined by the Variable Datum ID and Variable Datum length. This field shall be padded at the end to make the length a multiple of 64-bits.

fixedRecordData.name: VelocityVectorStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The rate at which the position is changing over time.

field.name: XVelocity
field.semantics: Velocity component along the X axis.

field.name: YVelocity
field.semantics: Velocity component along the Y axis.

field.name: ZVelocity
field.semantics: Velocity component along the Z axis.

fixedRecordData.name: WorldLocationStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: The location of an object in the world coordinate system, as specified in IEEE Std 1278.1-1995 section 1.3.2.

field.name: X
field.semantics: Distance from the origin along the X axis.

field.name: Y
field.semantics: Distance from the origin along the Y axis.

field.name: Z
field.semantics: Distance from the origin along the Z axis.

variantRecordData.name: ParameterValueVariantStruct
variantRecordData.semantics: Variant record specifying the type of articulation parameter (articulated or attached part), and its type and value.

variantRecordData.name: SpatialVariantStruct

alternative.name: SpatialStatic
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing a static object.

alternative.name: SpatialFPW
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with a constant velocity (or low acceleration) linear motion in world coordinates.

alternative.name: SpatialRPW
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with a constant velocity (or low acceleration) linear motion, including rotation information, in world coordinates.

alternative.name: SpatialRVW
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with high speed or maneuvering at any speed, including rotation information, in world coordinates.

alternative.name: SpatialFVW
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with high speed or maneuvering at any speed in world coordinates.

alternative.name: SpatialFPB
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with a constant velocity (or low acceleration) linear motion in body axis coordinates.

alternative.name: SpatialRPB
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with a constant velocity (or low acceleration) linear motion, including rotation information, in body axis coordinates.

alternative.name: SpatialRVB
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with high speed or maneuvering at any speed, including rotation information, in body axis coordinates.

alternative.name: SpatialFVB
alternative.semantics: Variant for representing an object with high speed or maneuvering at any speed in body axis coordinates.

variantRecordData.semantics: Variant Record for a single spatial attribute.

variantRecordData.name: StationNameLocationVariantStruct

alternative.name: RelativeLocation
alternative.semantics: The location of the constituent part object relative to the host object entity coordinate system.

alternative.name: RelativeRangeAndBearing
alternative.semantics: The location of the constituent part object relative to the host object in polar coordinates.

variantRecordData.semantics: The station name at which the constituent part is located. In case of 'On Station', the alternative specifies its location relative to the host object.

note.label: RPRnoteBase1
note.semantics:
Federates shall send the time at which the data is valid in the user defined tag with every attribute values update and interaction. The time shall be in the first 8 bytes (octets) of the user defined tag, using the DIS timestamp field format (see section 5.2.31 of IEEE 1278.1-1995) converted into hexadecimal ASCII character representation (0-9 and A-F). The ordering of the characters shall be in accordance with section 5.1.1 of IEEE 1278.1-1995, that is most significant octet first, with the most significant bits first (i.e. the character for bits 4-7 precedes the character for bits 0-3).
All federates shall transmit this field, even if they do not use it themselves, so that other federates can use its value to compensate for network transport delays.

note.label: RPRnoteBase2
note.semantics: Not optional

note.label: RPRnoteBase3
note.semantics: Default value: all zeros

note.label: RPRnoteBase4
note.semantics: This must reference a valid Object instance.

note.label: RPRnoteBase5
note.semantics: All fields in the entity type struct are enumerations. The values for the individual fields are to be derived from the federation agreements, which could refer to SISO-REF-010. The values used in this structure should comply with the requirements specified in section 5.2.16 of IEEE 1278.1-1995 (for platform and environmental entities) and section 5.2.39 of IEEE 1278.1a-1998 (for aggregate entities).

note.label: RPRnoteBase6
note.semantics: This note applies when this datatype is used within the BaseEntity.IsPartOf attribute. The following StationName enumerations - On station RNG/BRG (15) and On station - x,y,z (16), are optional to transmit along with associated RelativeLocation or RelativeRangeAndBearing information. If these enumeration values (15) and (16) are received, they shall be ignored. The RelativeSpatial attribute shall be used in all cases. (Note: Although the RelativeLocation field uses the same WorldLocation contained in the RelativeSpatial attribute, in both these cases, the values do not represent a location in world coordinates, but, rather, the relative location of a part entity to the host entity in the referenced entity coordinate system. The RelativeRangeAndBearing field does not provide full relative spatial data and, therefore, cannot be substituted for the RelativeSpatial attribute.)

note.label: RPRnoteBase7
note.semantics: The units of the Value field depends on the value of the TypeMetric field. The units are defined in section A.2.1.4 of IEEE 1278.1-1995.

note.label: RPRnoteBase8
note.semantics: The TSPI_Change condition shall be evaluated as follows: The owner of a base entity object shall maintain two state models of the object in support of the dead reckoning process. One model shall be the internal model used by the simulation application to represent that object. The other shall be a dead reckoning model of the object. Certain thresholds shall be established as criteria for determining if the object's actual TSPI data has varied by an allowable amount from the dead reckoned TSPI data. TSPI_Change is TRUE when either: a) the objects actual position differs from the dead reckoned position by more than DRA_POS_THRSH_DFLT b) the objects actual orientation differs from the dead reckoned orientation by more than DRA_ORIENT_THRSH_DFLT See section 5.1.4 of IEEE 1278.1-1995 for the value of these symbolic constants.

note.label: RPRnoteBase9
note.semantics: The values of the default update conditions are as follows: DRA_POS_EPSILON_DFLT 0.001 m DRA_ORIENT_EPSILON_DFLT 0.00001 rad DRA_VEL_EPSILON_DFLT 0.001 m/s DRA_ACCEL_EPSILON_DFLT 0.001 m/s/s DRA_ANG_VEL_EPSILON_DFLT 0.00001 rad/s

note.label: RPRnoteBase10
note.semantics: The update condition for the WorldLocation field is TRUE when TSPI_Change is TRUE and the actual position differs from the last transmitted position by more than a threshold value in any direction. The default threshold shall be DRA_POS_EPSILSON_DFLT.

note.label: RPRnoteBase11
note.semantics: The update condition for the Orientation field is TRUE when TSPI_Change is TRUE and the actual orientation differs from the last transmitted orientation by more than a threshold value in any orientation. The default threshold shall be DRA_ORIENT_EPSILON_DFLT.

note.label: RPRnoteBase12
note.semantics: In case Dead Reckoning Algorithm FPW (2), RPW (3), RVW (4), FVW (5), FPB (6), RPB (7), RVB (8), or RVB (9) is used, the update condition for the VelocityVector field is TRUE when TSPI_Change is TRUE and the actual velocity differs from the last transmitted velocity by more than a threshold value in any direction. The default threshold shall be DRA_VEL_EPSILON_DFLT.

note.label: RPRnoteBase13
note.semantics: In case Dead Reckoning Algorithm RVW (4), FVW (5), RVB (8), or RVB (9) is used, the update condition for the AccelerationVector field is TRUE when TSPI_Change is TRUE and the actual acceleration differs from the last transmitted acceleration by more than a threshold value in any direction. The default threshold shall be DRA_ACCEL_EPSILON_DFLT.

note.label: RPRnoteBase14
note.semantics: In case Dead Reckoning Algorithm RPW (3), RVW (4), RPB (7), or RVB (8) is used, the update condition for the VelocityVector field is TRUE when TSPI_Change is TRUE and the actual angular velocity differs from the last transmitted angular velocity by more than a threshold value in any direction. The default threshold shall be DRA_ANG_VEL_EPSILON_DFLT.

note.label: RPRnoteBase15
note.semantics: Frozen entities should not be dead-reckoned, i.e. should be displayed as fixed at the current location even if non-zero velocity, acceleration or rotation data received from the frozen entity.

note.label: RPRnoteBase16
note.semantics: The DatumLength equals the length in bits of the DatumValue only. The total size of a VariableDatumStruct record must account for the padding length.

note.label: RPRnoteBase17
note.semantics: The type of the DatumValue field is determined by the value of the DatumID field. The types and associated units, etc., for each of the DatumID enumeration values are to be derived from the federation agreements, which could refer to SISO-REF-010. The DatumValue element type is defined as a UnsignedInteger64 (64 bits) to ensure the correct byte alignment for types that include 64-bit elements.

note.label: RPRnoteBase18
note.semantics: If the entity is a constituent part of another entity (denoted by the IsPartOf attribute being set appropriately) then the Spatial attribute may be ignored by a receiving federate. Instead, the receiving federate can calculate spatial attribute values by adding the offsets provided in the RelativeSpatial attribute to the values provided in the host entity's Spatial attribute. Even if a federate is updating RelativeSpatial, it should still update Spatial for the benefit of federates who do not subscribe to the optional RelativeSpatial and IsPartOf attributes.

note.label: RPRnoteBase19
note.semantics: If the entity is a constituent part of another entity (denoted by the IsPartOf attribute being set appropriately) then the IsFrozen attribute is no longer updated. The frozen status of the entity is the same as the frozen status of the host entity.

note.label: RPRnoteBase20
note.semantics: Damaged appearance for environment objects has values 0: no damage, 1: damaged and 2: destroyed, with respect to the DIS standard as defined in SISO-REF-010 (section 12.1.2.1) ; this has to be taken into account when setting up a DIS-HLA gateway (SDEM mapping and filtering)
